catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.

description: woman collapsing a hanging paper lantern with a burning candle inside; two lanterns visible, which are white with red floral and leaf designs; woman wears a blue kimono with blue and grey abstract leaf patterns, red trim and brown obi with yellow leaf fronds
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫工与吉 {horikō Yokichi}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 25 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Observant, Behavior of a Kyoto Waitress of the Meiji Period
